ratings.comment: Prof. Alfredo is a nobleman. He erases the boards once he is done with a class. He also has clear handwriting and logic, best I've ever seen in a math professor. 100 out of 10.

Great professor. Content is difficult, but Professor Wetzel gives many different ways of understanding the material. Extremely helpful in his office hours (held three sessions each week) and is very patient with students. He explains how he approaches the problems seen in classes well, which was very helpful to learn from. Lectures are entertaining

He is passionate about the subject and also seems to enjoy teaching, which combines for amazing lectures. That being said it is a difficult class and with a relatively low curve, focus on understanding homework problems if you want to do well on exams. His office hours are very helpful and he is great in small group scenarios.
He's hilarious and really good at engaging his students. He likes to go in depth, so make sure to go to class, but he also makes it interesting. Overall a wonderful professor.

Alfredo is a very good teacher in the sense that he explains things very well and (usually) very clearly. However, he made this class unnecessarily hard. The HW consisted of 10 stupidly difficult problems--these were hard to learn from. Exams were also unnecessarily difficult for the majority of the class (mean on final was 54.4...) lol Good luck
The class has very difficult exams which are worth 80 percent of the total class grade.

Professor Wetzel let's his sense of humor get in the way of giving effective lectures. If he focussed more, topics could be explained more clearly or at least with more examples. Studying for tests is difficult as no answers for practice problems are posted to check your work, so practice heavily relies on hw which are much easier than tests.
Gives straightforward lectures and explains complicated topics in ways that are easier to understand. His humor makes lectures even more enjoyable.

Likely the best math professor in the entire department. He's funny, cares deeply about students; helpful during office hours; explains topics clearly and multiple times during lecture, and reviews material from the last lecture; homework is pretty hard and time-consuming, tests are about equal in difficulty. Class is hard. Take Alfredo if you can

Great professor, super funny, talks very fast, young grad student, works hard, explains concepts very well, good at answering questions.  Top 20% of lecturers.  Tough grader (for overall grade in class).  Class average was 63%, I got 64%, class was curved around a BC, I got a BC.

Prof. Wetzel's lectures are always entertaining.  His dry jokes mixed with 1980s references never fail to elicit a chuckle.  He simplifies complex subjects very well in class.  Homework is much more advanced than class and takes some time to do.  Tests are harder than lecture material, but easier than homework.  I'd take him again in a heartbeat!

Awesome professor. Care about students, I'll say he is extremely helpful in office hour. Exams pretty much just like the practice exam and you can bring a note card. HW is super hard but quiz is very easy. Very rare good professors in the entire math department.

Great teacher. Entertaining and knows what he's talking about. Also goes out of his way to help you with the material and make sure you get it if you approach him. Does write hard tests so be aware of that.
